definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: Europeanization is the output of language contact between the English and Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 汉语的欧化现象是鸦片战争以来英汉语言接触的产物。

sentences.english: To calm his mind he began to take laudanum.
sentences.chinese: 为了镇定自己的神经，他开始服鸦片酊。

sentences.english: It was after Opium War that Western photography was introduced into China.
sentences.chinese: 摄影术是鸦片战争后由西方传入我国的。

sentences.english: On the third day, they handed over 20000 chests of opium.
sentences.chinese: 第三天，他们就交出了两万箱鸦片。

sentences.english: In 1970, high-grade heroin and opium flooded Southeast Asia.
sentences.chinese: 1970年东南亚的高纯度海洛因和鸦片泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: Hong Kong was British Colony occupied for opium wars, exploitations.
sentences.chinese: 香港被英国强占，发动多次鸦片战争，侵略中国。

sentences.english: After the Opium War (1840-1842), western culture began to enter China in a large amount.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，西方文化开始大盘进入中国。

sentences.english: After the Opium War of 1840 -1842, China slowly became semi - colonial and semi - feudal society country.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，中国逐渐沦为半殖民地半封建国家。

sentences.english: It is much more destructive than opium can ever hope to be, even though just as addictive.
sentences.chinese: 破坏性比鸦片更强数倍，成瘾性还是一样的厉害。

sentences.english: The peasant protested he didn't know where there was any opium.
sentences.chinese: 他答称，他不知道那里有鸦片烟。

sentences.english: As for the Opium Wars, a strictly legal perspective is ludicrous .
sentences.chinese: 谈到鸦片战争，严格法律的提发是可笑的。

sentences.english: The Opium War of 1840marked a turning piont in chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 1840年爆发的鸦片战争标志着中国历史的转折。

sentences.english: Carter describes it as "opium den chic."
sentences.chinese: 卡特形容为“鸦片烟馆别致它。

sentences.english: It macerates its opium and percolates its own laudanum and paregoric.
sentences.chinese: 它泡软鸦片，过滤自己的鸦片酊和止痛剂。

sentences.english: It macerates its opium and percolates its own laudanum and paregoric.
sentences.chinese: 它泡软鸦片，过滤自己的鸦片酊和止痛剂。

sentences.english: 1912 - The International Opium Convention is signed at The Hague.
sentences.chinese: 1912年的今天，国际鸦片公约在海牙签署。

definition: Lin Zexu or Lin Tse-hsu "Commissioner Lin" (1785-1850), Qing official whose anti-opium activities led to first Opium war with Britain 1840-1842
a form of transit taxation in China introduced to finance armies to suppress the Taiping Rebellion
variant of 鴉片|鸦片[ya1 pian4]
